WRITING.TEXT: The Tower of Terror loop is awesome and ominous. I love it too :D
Does it feel like you're in space? xD

WRITING.TITLE: Favorite Music of Disneyland
WRITING.TEXT: I find myself listening to Disneyland music all the time. While I love the music, just the nostalgia is incredible. I love finding new tracks that you heard in the parks that bring back so many new memories. This leads me to my question. What is your favorite ride soundtrack, area music, or attraction music at Disneyland Resort? (if you want to be really awesome you can post a link)

I think the most magical thing about Disneyland is the fact that this is where Walt stood and created this amazing place. I've never been to WDW but I feel like from a Californian perspective it's just trying to recreate the magic that Walt created. I'm sure you can have fun at any Disney theme park but Disneyland is truly the creation of Walt Disney and you just can't recreate that. Please don't hate on me for thinking this way. It's just my honest opinion.
Is it a regular dark ride or something like indiana jones?
Yeah it was really out of this world. (haha get it?)
Glad to hear someone agree with me

Despite being an overlay of a ride that already exists, I actually think Hyperspace Mountain may be my favorite. I already love star wars and racing around ti-fighters around jakku was really awesome.
My least favorite it easy. It has to be Autopia. I know everyone loves it because its nostalgic and stuff but I find it extremely boring and annoying. The steering barely does anything. You get a nice view of the rusting people-mover tracks. Not to mention it doesn't really fit in tomorrowland.
March of the resistance is my favorite :)
Wow as soon as I put this on I recognized it! Good ear!

WRITING.TITLE: Star Wars Seasons of The Force Music?
WRITING.TEXT: Hi! In January I went to Disneyland and saw Star Wars seasons of the Force for the first time. I thought it was pretty cool. I noticed in the background they used a lot of star wars music. I couldn't quite make out some of the soundtracks. I really want to find them. It would be amazing if someone could compile a list of the music tracks in the background of the new Tomorrowland.

I sure wish they would. But there really isn't any space. I have heard Disneyland is buying a lot of the hotels around the parks. Perhaps they'll demolish them to make space? That's probably just wishful thinking. So I doubt it.

That's true. However, I don't think it's new success has too much to do with that. Obviously they made Buena Vista St. which is beautiful. Tower of Terror, while based on the twilight zone, is an original concept. I think while some of its success came from IP attractions may have helped. There were other factors.

Yes you're right. I didn't think about that. However, Matterhorn doesn't have that much to do about that movie. Obviously Pirates has been changed to fit in with the movie. However, they're not completely based on the movies. I guess space mountain is a better example. Thank you for pointing that out.
That looks really cool!

WRITING.TITLE: Ideas for original rides.
WRITING.TEXT: It seems like most rides that come out now are based on movies and cartoons. One thing we haven't seen in a really long time is an original concept like pirates or Matterhorn. This leads to my question. What are some good ideas for original rides or attractions?
Wow that's hilarious! I can't believe a moderator commented on my post. xD

WRITING.TITLE: What stories do you have about jungle cruise skippers?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm curious to hear all about how far your jungle cruise skipper went to make you laugh. Or maybe you'd rather share a tale about one that was so boring that you wanted to jump out of the boat. Either way I want to hear from you! Post your stories down below
I now pronounce you the king of waiting in line!
wow

WRITING.TITLE: What is the longest line you have waited in?
WRITING.TEXT: As the title suggests I am curious how long you guys have waited for a ride. I'm not the type of person who waits more than an hour for something but I know there are people who do that. What is the longest line you've waited in and for what ride? Was it worth it? Share your answers down below!

I totally agree. I really love the soundtrack and the story. It was raining one day and we went on it and got stuck in hell (which is actually part of the ride). Fortunately there was a huge heater above us so we warmed up.

WRITING.TITLE: If you had to go on an adventure and you could take one movie character along-side you, who would you take?
Most Underrated Thing at Disneyland?
WRITING.TEXT: Most people praise only a few different attractions at Disneyland while other, still awesome, attractions are left underrated. What are some places and rides most people either don't like, don't care about, or don't even know about at both parks? I personally really enjoy Mr. Lincoln but not a lot of people go there.

There is a secret area behind the harbor galley restaurant near critter country. It's right above where the drop goes on splash mountain so you can watch the people go down. Also, not many people know about it so it's always very quiet and peaceful
That is genius!
I totally agree. The parts where you are supposedly shooting your laser cannons light up a lot of the supports and kind of ruins it.
I just like it because of the music xD
That would be awesome.
I just hate the 3D glasses. I already wear eyeglasses and putting those beefy 3D ones over my already heavy glasses is a pain.
That's true.
I live in Nor-cal and I have an annual pass.

I understand why people love autopia. "It's an original ride" "Its nostalgic". I don't care why people love it. I really hope it gets demolished. Its a huge waste of space and doesn't fit the theme of tomorrowland. Not to mention all of the old rusty peoplemover tracks right above it. I just really don't like that ride and I hope that it is removed to make way for something better.

WRITING.TITLE: Opinions on Hyperspace Mountain
WRITING.TEXT: I've seen a lot of varied opinions on the subject. Some go as far to say that Hyperspace is better than the original. Some go as far to say it's so horrible they refuse to go to the parks. I personally enjoy the new effects and music. I like it about as much as the original. But i'm curious about the people of other people's opinions on Hyperspace Mountain. Do you love it? Do you hate it? Put your answers down below!
Finally they end that. It always bothers me when we're going to monster's inc. and we have to dodge the parading people in the Mad T Party.
Awesome Trivia guys! Keep 'em coming!

WRITING.TITLE: Random Disneyland Trivia!
WRITING.TEXT: This is a post for everyone to share their secrets with each other! I want to hear the coolest, weirdest, and most interesting trivia you got. Everybody knows that there's a basketball hoop in the Matterhorn. I want to hear some new Disneyland trivia!
Yeah that part is really good
Why? It would make no sense to keep it. It's like putting a Cars ride in paradise pier!
It might be closed for a bit while they're re-routing the train tracks but I don't think it will be closed for long and I doubt there will be any major changes.
I heard about that! They're going to have to remove star tours once star wars land opens. Hopefully we're getting and iron man ride too!

I really think the peoplemover track should be used. With all the new technology, they can make a really cool ride. If they aren't going to use it they should just remove the track. It really decreases mobility in tomorrowland.
Space Voyage. Because of the success of the Matterhorn, Walt wanted to make a space indoor roller coaster with 4 tracks!

WRITING.TITLE: Which firework show is your favorite?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm just curious the opinions of others on the subject. Do you like the new "Disneyland Forever" or did you like the nostalgic "Remember... Dreams Come True"? Maybe you're more of a "Magical" sort of person. I personally really enjoy "Disneyland Forever" but I see why people might like others. Post your favorite down below!
Yep
Agreed. I might even like it more than the original. Oh I can hear the hate replies coming already xD.
So true xD

Gee. I think I would have to go with Splash. I think its fun in the summer when its super hot and in the winter its fun trying super hard not to get wet. The line isn't ever too long and when it is fastpasses are always avaliable.
That is not a bad idea actually xD
I don't not not not want it but......
I already tried finding a driver software and I couldn't so I tried connecting it about an hour after I started my computer. Now, for some reason, it won't even connect.

WRITING.TITLE: Wireless headphones not working.
WRITING.TEXT: I recently got some Hesh 2 Skullcandy wireless headphones. I tried the wireless feature on my phone and it worked without any problems. After that, I used them on my Windows 7 Alienware computer. They worked fairly well, however they did studder sometimes. About a week ago I turned them on and connected them to my computer and the sound quality was horrible. I can't plug them in to my computer because my earphone jack is broken. I really want to fix them. I hope you can help me.
I just found that website after I posted this. It has a lot of cool audio but not a whole lot of recent stuff.
I went to the last d23 expo in 2015. If only I got this message in August xD. Thanks for the info though!

WRITING.TITLE: Anyone know any cool disneyland soundtracks.
WRITING.TEXT: I love going around the internet trying to find all the sound effects from disneyland. I was curious if anyone has any really unique music or sound. It can be anything from ride spiels to the red car boys music in DCA. I really hope you guys can find some cool stuff!

1. The moment where you are just about to go off the drop on splash mountain
2. Fiery duck wings at Carthay Circle. Hands Down
3. Pirates right after the drop
4. Cats going around at night eating mice. (I've even seen them during the day)
5. Tomorrowland should be deeply renovated. It needs better mobility and to be more futuristic. I also say that if they're going to keep the peoplemover track then they should do something with it.

WRITING.TITLE: Question about mousewait app.
WRITING.TEXT: I was at Disneyland last week and while looking at the mousewait app there was a button for getting fastpasses. I thought it was too good to be true. I never got a chance to try it which leads me to wonder if it actually works. Someone please try it at the parks. I really would like to know if this is a hoax!
Crowds can be unpredictable. Be sure to plan your day out well. It could be crowded or it might not be. It's almost all luck.
